title: Isn't promotion series a bit redundant?
body:
Why is it needed?

Get rid of it. 

Going from 0 - 100 is enough to warrant a promotion.  A 2/3 win AFTER 0-100 serves absolutely no purpose.

replies.body:

I'm not saying the current system is very good or anything, but every time I see a thread about removing promotions they never mention anything about demotion or LP gains/losses and MMR.
I'm okay with being able to lose easily. I rarely hit 0 LP. I almost always hit 100 and float around 80 LP because I lose promos 5 times.

OK.) and I don't get why there's a promotion round between, say, Silver 3 and Silver 2. Maybe in high level it makes sense, since the skill levels are substantially different, but at low levels it just means more "must-win" games.

The order where you win your provisional games is very important, as the system adjusts your MMR on the fly. Provisional games (on a fresh account, not an account that has had a division in a previous season) have a "homeguards like" effect attached to them - the first game you play results in a very large elo swing, and the variance diminishes until you finish your provisional games.

For example, Winning the first two games in provisionals of an account that has never played ranked, and then losing the next game, will result in a much higher MMR than losing the first game and winning the next two.
